contents:
A diary can serve as a stimulant to feeling. It can remind the author, whether she is writing from prison or the warfront or a sickbed or—blessedly—from the safety and comfort of her own home, that she is alive. What’s more, a diary builds parameters around that life: it determines which details are underscored or elided, which moods roll through, which memories impinge.


真是好喜欢此君的writing。:)
